brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this project is to gather pilot data related to exploring relationships
      between cognitive impairment and/or psychiatric distress and suicidal thoughts and/or
      behaviors in Veterans with Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)/Acquired Immune Deficiency
      Syndrome (AIDS). To achieve this goal, a neuropsychological battery will be administered to
      Veterans with HIV/AIDS.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Cognitive Functioning as it Relates to Risk for Suicide in Veterans With HIV/AIDS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Veterans between ages 18 to 65

          -  Have a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS confirmed via medical record

          -  Currently receiving or eligible to receive physical and/or mental health care through
             the VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute intoxication via alcohol or other illicit drugs at time of assessment as
             determined by observation and/or interview.

          -  Psychosis at time of interview as determined by observation and/or interview.

          -  Poor Test of Memory Malingering (TOMM) performance (scores below 25 on Trial 1 or
             scores lower than 45 on Trial 2)

          -  Current status as a prisoner

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Cognitive Functioning as it Relates to Risk for Suicide in Veterans With HIV/AIDS

primary_outcome.description: The WAIS-IV is a widely used and well established instrument used to assesses an individual's intellectual functioning within various cognitive domains and organizes performance into several indices including Verbal Comprehension Index, Perceptual Reasoning Index, Working Memory Index, and Processing Speed Index. A composite, Full Scale IQ, is also generated to represent an estimation of overall intellectual functioning.

The TMT is a timed, pencil-paper, measure of attention, speed, and cognitive flexibility and requires participants to draw a line to accurately sequence 25 circles containing numbers (Part A) and alternating letters and numbers (Part B).
primary_outcome.measure: Trail Making Test (TMT): Parts A & B

primary_outcome.description: The CVLT-II examines several aspects of verbal learning, organization, and memory.
primary_outcome.measure: California Verbal Learning Test, Second Edition (CVLT-II)

primary_outcome.description: The BVMT-R measures immediate and delayed visual memory.
The OQ-45 is a 45-item questionnaire that was designed to measure key areas of mental health functioning (symptom distress, interpersonal functioning, and social role).
The BSS is a 19-item scale that assesses severity of suicide ideation.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The HSQ is a 39-item, multiple choice, self-report measure that collects patient-reported, subjective data on eight subscales: Health Perception, Physical Functioning, Role Limitations/Physical Health, Role Limitations/Emotional Problems, Social Functioning, Mental Health, Bodily Pain and Energy/Fatigue.
The UWRAP will be used to address potential risk associated with participating in the study.
secondary_outcome.measure: University of Washington Risk Assessment Protocol-Revised (UWRAP)

secondary_outcome.description: The TOMM is a measure of effortful performance on objective tasks.
The SCID is a reliable and valid semi-structured interview used to make psychiatric diagnosis in both clinical and research settings.
secondary_outcome.measure: The Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV-Research Version (SCID-I)

secondary_outcome.description: The L-SASI was developed as a very brief survey of lifetime intentional self-harm behaviors and categorizes them into suicide attempts and non-suicidal acts.
secondary_outcome.measure: Lifetime Suicide Attempt Self Injury Interview (L-SASI)

secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire was created by members of the research team to collect data regarding demographics.
The OSU TBI-ID Short Form will be used to determine history of TBI and presence of persistent TBI-related complaints.
secondary_outcome.measure: Ohio State University TBI-ID (OSU TBI-ID) Short Form

secondary_outcome.description: The BHS is a 20-item true-false self-report scale that measures the level of negative expectations about the future held by respondents.
The BDI-II is a widely used 21 item, self-administered instrument used to detect depression.
The BAI is a widely-used, 21-item, self-administered instrument used to measure the severity of an individual's anxiety.
The Common Data Elements are a compilation of validated and reliable measures used to gather data on the risk factors for suicidal behavioral.
secondary_outcome.measure: Military Suicide Research Consortium (MSRC) Common Data Elements

clinical_study.source: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System
